context.arch.subscriber
Class Subscribers

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,AbstractSubscriber>
          context.arch.subscriber.Subscribers
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap<java.lang.String,AbstractSubscriber>, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,AbstractSubscriber>
public class Subscribers
extends java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,AbstractSubscriber>

This class maintains a list of subscribers, allows additions, removals and updates to individual subscribers. Agathe: I have changed Subscribers and Subscriber to allow the addition of the DiscovererSubscriber class. Subscriber and DiscovererSubscriber implement an interface handled by Subscribers. Agathe: modify restart subscription TODO: consider using MySQL for persistence of subscription instead of a local flat file --Brian TODO: anyway, the storage files are not strict XML because they are delimited with ENTRY_STRING

See Also:
Subscriber, Serialized Form

updateSubscriber

public void updateSubscriber(AbstractSubscriber sub)
Updates a subscriber in the subscriber list. The subscriber name is retrieved from the subscriber object and the old subscriber entry with this name is replaced by the given one.

Parameters:
sub - Subscriber object to update

updateSubscriber

public void updateSubscriber(AbstractSubscriber sub,
                             boolean log)
Updates a subscriber in the subscriber list. The subscriber name is retrieved from the subscriber object and the old subscriber entry with this name is replaced by the given one.

Parameters:
sub - Subscriber object to update
log - Whether to log the subscribe or not
